title: References
summary: Curated collection of authoritative references for cancer staging systems
author: OncoVISTA Team

content.text: 1. Foundational Resources for TNM and Cancer Staging

items: American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC). AJCC Cancer Staging Manual, 8th Edition. Springer; 2017. - Standard reference for TNM classification across all major solid tumors.
Union for International Cancer Control (UICC). TNM Classification of Malignant Tumours, 8th Edition. Wiley-Blackwell; 2017. - UICC's harmonized counterpart to AJCC's system.
Amin MB, Edge SB, Greene FL, et al. Overview of changes in the TNM classification in the 8th edition. CA Cancer J Clin. 2017;67(2):93–99. - Comprehensive summary of updates across tumor types.
Edge SB, Compton CC. The AJCC Cancer Staging Manual: Continuing to build a bridge from a population-based to a more "personalized" approach to cancer staging. CA Cancer J Clin. 2010;60(2):109–112.
Goldstraw P, et al. The IASLC Lung Cancer Staging Project: Proposals for the 8th Edition. J Thorac Oncol. 2016;11(1):39–51. - Defines new T descriptors and M1 subcategories.
Giuliano AE, et al. Breast cancer staging: Changes in the AJCC 8th edition. CA Cancer J Clin. 2017;67(4):290–303. - Introduced prognostic staging incorporating ER/PR/HER2 status and grade.
Tie J, et al. Circulating tumor DNA analysis guides adjuvant therapy in stage II colon cancer. N Engl J Med. 2022;386:2261–2272. - Demonstrates how liquid biopsy augments staging and recurrence risk.
Amin MB, Edge SB. AJCC Prostate Cancer Staging Manual, 8th Edition. Springer. - Emphasizes integration of PSA, Gleason Grade Group, and T stage.
Cheson BD, et al. Recommendations for evaluation and response in lymphoma: Lugano classification. J Clin Oncol. 2014;32(27):3059–3067.
Cheson BD, et al. Revised response criteria for malignant lymphoma. J Clin Oncol. 2007;25(5):579–586. - Emphasis on PET-adapted strategies and Deauville scale.
Bhatla N, et al. Revised FIGO staging for carcinoma of the cervix uteri. Int J Gynaecol Obstet. 2019;145(1):129–135. - Integration of imaging and surgical findings.
Prat J. FIGO staging for uterine cancers. Int J Gynaecol Obstet. 2009;104(3):177–178.
Greipp PR, et al. International staging system (ISS) for multiple myeloma. J Clin Oncol. 2005;23(15):3412–3420.
Palumbo A, et al. Revised ISS (R-ISS). J Clin Oncol. 2015;33(26):2863–2869.
D'Agostino M, et al. R2-ISS: Expanded staging for newly diagnosed myeloma. J Clin Oncol. 2022;40(29):3356–3365.
Monclair T, et al. The International Neuroblastoma Risk Group (INRG) staging system. Cancer. 2009;115(13):2651–2663.

content.text: This curated list of references provides the foundation for understanding both traditional and modern staging systems across cancer types. As staging becomes more biologically informed, it is essential to remain updated on evolving guidelines from AJCC, UICC, FIGO, NCCN, and disease-specific working groups. These tools collectively shape patient stratification, prognosis, and treatment selection in contemporary oncology.
